      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                        # position is auto-generated by DB sequence
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                        # created_at will be set automatically
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

                      )
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

            
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                      # Convert to domain event
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                      domain_event = domain_event_from_record(record)
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

            
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                      # Cache the event

                      domain_event
          
      103.

                    end
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                  end
          
      105.

                  def read_events(from_position: 0, limit: nil)
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                    # Query the database
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                    query = DomainEvent.since_position(from_position).chronological
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                    query = query.limit(limit) if limit
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

            
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                    # Convert to domain events and cache them
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            

            

                    query.map do |record|
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                      # Check cache first
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                      event_id = record.id.to_s
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                      @events_cache[event_id] ||= domain_event_from_record(record)
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                    end
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

                  end
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

            
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

                  def read_stream(aggregate_id:, from_position: 0, limit: nil)
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

                    # Query the database for events of a specific aggregate
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                    valid_aggregate_id = valid_uuid?(aggregate_id) ? aggregate_id : generate_uuid_from_string(aggregate_id)
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

            
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                    query = DomainEvent.for_aggregate(valid_aggregate_id)
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                                       .since_position(from_position)
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                                       .chronological
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

            
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                    query = query.limit(limit) if limit
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

            
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

                    # Convert to domain events and cache them
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

                    query.map do |record|
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

                      # Check cache first
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

                      event_id = record.id.to_s
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                      @events_cache[event_id] ||= domain_event_from_record(record)
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            

            

                    end
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                  end
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

            
          
      137.

                  # Convert a DomainEvent record to a Core::Domain::Event
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            

            

                  def domain_event_from_record(record)
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            

            

                    Core::Domain::Event.new(
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            

            

                      id: record.id.to_s,
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            

            

                      name: record.event_type,
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            

            

                      source: record.aggregate_id,
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            

            

                      timestamp: record.created_at,
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            

            

                      data: record.payload
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            

            

                    )
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            

            

                  end
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            

            

            
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            

            

                  # Check if a string is a valid UUID
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            

            

                  def valid_uuid?(string)
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            

            

                    uuid_regex = /^[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12}$/i
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            

            

                    uuid_regex.match?(string.to_s)
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            

                  end
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            

            
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            

                  # Generate a deterministic UUID from a string
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            

            

                  def generate_uuid_from_string(string)
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            

            

                    # Simply use a random UUID for now
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            

            

                    # In a production system, you might want to use a more deterministic approach
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            

            

                    # such as a namespace UUID (v5) if available
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            

            

                    SecureRandom.uuid
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            

            

                  end
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            

            

            
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            

            

                  def metric_repository

    195.

    196. 
            

            

                  end
          
      197.

                end

                  def save_metric(metric)
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                    # Create a database record
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
              101
            

            

                    domain_metric = DomainMetric.create!(
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                      name: metric.name,
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                      value: metric.value,
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                      source: metric.source,
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                      dimensions: metric.dimensions,
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                      recorded_at: metric.timestamp
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                    )
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

            
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                    # Update the domain metric with the database ID if needed
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
              101
            

            

                    if metric.id.nil?
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
              98
            

            

                      metric = metric.with_id(domain_metric.id.to_s)
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                    end
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                    # Store in memory cache for tests
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            
              101
            

            

                    @metrics_cache[metric.id] = metric
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

            
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                    # Return the domain metric
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            
              101
            

            

                    metric
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                  end
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

            
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def find_metric(id)
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                    # Try to find in memory cache first (for tests)
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
              7
            

            

                    return @metrics_cache[id] if @metrics_cache.key?(id)
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

            
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                    # Find in database - for composite primary key, we need to use find_by
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
              2
            

            

                    domain_metric = DomainMetric.find_by(id: id)
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
              2
            

            

                    return nil unless domain_metric
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

            
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                    # Convert to domain model
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

                    metric = Core::Domain::Metric.new(
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                      id: domain_metric.id.to_s,
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                      name: domain_metric.name,
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42.

      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                      source: domain_metric.source,
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                      dimensions: domain_metric.dimensions || {},
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                      timestamp: domain_metric.recorded_at
          
      46.

      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

            
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                    # Cache for future lookups
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                    @metrics_cache[metric.id] = metric
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

            
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                    metric
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                  end
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

            
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def list_metrics(filters = {})
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                    # Start with a base query
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
              10
            

            

                    query = DomainMetric.all
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

            
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                    # Apply filters
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
              10
            

            

                    query = query.with_name(filters[:name]) if filters[:name]
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
              10
            

            

                    query = query.since(filters[:start_time]) if filters[:start_time]
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
              10
            

            

                    query = query.until(filters[:end_time]) if filters[:end_time]
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
              10
            

            

                    query = query.latest_first if filters[:latest_first]
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
              10
            

            

                    query = query.limit(filters[:limit]) if filters[:limit]
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

            
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                    # Convert to domain models
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
              10
            

            

                    query.map do |domain_metric|
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
              31
            

            

                      Core::Domain::Metric.new(
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                        id: domain_metric.id.to_s,
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                        name: domain_metric.name,
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                        value: domain_metric.value,
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                        source: domain_metric.source,
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                        dimensions: domain_metric.dimensions || {},
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                        timestamp: domain_metric.recorded_at
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                      )
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                    end
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                  end
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

            
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def get_average(name, start_time = nil, end_time = nil)
          
      79.

                  # Implements the IngestionPort interface

                  # Parses the raw payload and creates a Domain Event
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

                  # @param raw_payload [String] The raw JSON webhook payload
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                  # @param source [String] The source system (github, jira, gitlab, etc.)
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

                  # @return [Core::Domain::Event] A domain event
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                  def receive_event(raw_payload, source:)
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                    # Parse the JSON payload
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                    parsed_payload = JSON.parse(raw_payload, symbolize_names: true)
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

            
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                    # Create and return a domain event based on the source
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

                    case source
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                    when "github"
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                      handle_github_event(parsed_payload)
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

                    when "jira"
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                      handle_jira_event(parsed_payload)
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                    when "gitlab"
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                      handle_gitlab_event(parsed_payload)
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

                    when "bitbucket"
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                      handle_bitbucket_event(parsed_payload)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                    else
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                      handle_generic_event(parsed_payload, source)
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                    end
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                  rescue JSON::ParserError => e
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error("Invalid JSON payload: #{e.message}")
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                    raise InvalidPayloadError, "Invalid JSON payload"
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                  end
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

            
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                  # Validate webhook signatures based on the source
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                  # @param payload [String] The raw webhook payload
          
      35.

                  # @param signature [String] The signature header
          
      36.

                  # @return [Boolean] Whether the signature is valid

                  def validate_webhook_signature(payload, signature)

                  # Handle GitHub specific event mapping
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                  def handle_github_event(payload)
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                    # Determine event type from payload
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                    # GitHub webhooks can have various formats depending on the event type
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                    event_type = determine_github_event_type(payload)
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                    repository = payload.dig(:repository, :full_name) || "unknown"
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.debug { "Creating GitHub event: #{event_type} for repo: #{repository}" }
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

            
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                    # Create a domain event using the loaded Core::Domain::Event class
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                    # Log before creating to help debug any issues
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            

            

                    begin
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            

            

                      event = Core::Domain::Event.new(
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            

            

                        name: "github.#{event_type}",
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            

            

                        source: "github",
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            

            

                        data: payload,
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                        timestamp: Time.current
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                      )
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.debug { "Successfully created event: #{event.id}" }
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

                      event
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                    rescue StandardError => e
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.error("Error creating event: #{e.message}")
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.error(e.backtrace.join("\n"))
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                      raise e
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                    end
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                  end
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

            
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                  # Helper method to determine GitHub event type from payload
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

                  def determine_github_event_type(payload)
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                    if payload[:ref] && payload[:commits]
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                      # This is a push event
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                      "push"
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                    elsif payload[:action] && payload[:issue]
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                      # This is an issue event
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

                      "issue.#{payload[:action]}"
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                    elsif payload[:action] && payload[:pull_request]
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

                      # This is a pull request event
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                      "pull_request.#{payload[:action]}"
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                    elsif payload[:action] && payload[:comment] && payload[:issue]
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

                      # This is an issue comment event
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                      "issue_comment.#{payload[:action]}"
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

                    elsif payload[:action] && payload[:comment] && payload[:pull_request]
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

                      # This is a PR comment event
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

                      "pull_request_review_comment.#{payload[:action]}"
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

                    else
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

                      # Generic fallback
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

                      payload[:action] || "unknown"
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                    end
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                  end
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

            
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                  # Handle Jira specific event mapping
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            

            

                  def handle_jira_event(payload)
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                    event_type = payload[:webhookEvent] || "unknown"
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                    issue_key = payload.dig(:issue, :key) || "unknown"
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

            
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                    Core::Domain::Event.new(
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                      name: "jira.#{event_type}",
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                      source: "jira",
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                      data: payload,
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                      timestamp: Time.current
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                    )
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106.

      111.

      112.

      118.

                  end

                  def handle_bitbucket_event(payload)

                    event_type = payload[:event_key] || "unknown"

      125.

                  # Generic handler for other sources
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                  def handle_generic_event(payload, source)
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                    # Extract a reasonable event name or use a default
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                    event_type = payload[:type] || payload[:event] || payload[:action] || "event"
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

            
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

                    Core::Domain::Event.new(
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

                      name: "#{source}.#{event_type}",
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                      source: source,
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

                      data: payload,
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                      timestamp: Time.current
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

                    )
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                  end

              module Web

                class WebhooksController < ApplicationController
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

                  skip_before_action :verify_authenticity_token
          
      5.

      6.

                  include Ports::IngestionPort
          
      7.

      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

                  def create
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9.

                class GithubWebhookController < ApplicationController
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
              1
            

            

                  skip_before_action :verify_authenticity_token
          
      5.

              1
            

            

                  before_action :verify_github_signature
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

            
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            
              1
            

            

                  include Ports::IngestionPort
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            

            

                  # Handle all GitHub webhook events
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def create
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                    # Extract the event type from headers
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                    event_type = request.headers["X-GitHub-Event"]
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

            
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            

            

                    # Parse the payload
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            

            

                    payload = JSON.parse(request.body.read)
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            

            

            
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            

            

                    # Create a domain event based on the GitHub event type
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            

            

                    event = build_domain_event(event_type, payload)
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            

            

            
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            

            

                    # Process the event using the core use case
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            

            

                    use_case = UseCaseFactory.create_process_event
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            

            

                    processed_event = use_case.call(event)
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            

            

            
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            

            

                    # Return a success response
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            

            

                    render json: {
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            

            

                      status: "processed",
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                      id: processed_event.id,
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            

            

                      event_type: event_type
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            

            

                    }, status: :created
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            

            

                  rescue JSON::ParserError => e
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error("Invalid JSON in GitHub webhook: #{e.message}")
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            

            

                    render json: { error: "Invalid JSON payload" }, status: :bad_request
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            

            

                  rescue StandardError => e
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            

            

                    Rails.logger.error("Error processing GitHub webhook: #{e.message}")
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            

            

                    render json: { error: e.message }, status: :unprocessable_entity
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            

            

                  end
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            

            

            
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            

            

                  # Implementation of IngestionPort#receive_event
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def receive_event(payload)
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            

            

                    event_type = payload[:event_type]
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                    event_data = payload[:data]
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

            
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

                    # Create a domain event
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                    Core::Domain::Event.new(
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                      name: "github.#{event_type}",
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            

            

                      source: "github",
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            

            

                      data: event_data,
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            

            

                      timestamp: Time.current
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                    )
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                  end
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                  # Implementation of IngestionPort#validate_webhook_signature
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def validate_webhook_signature(payload, signature)
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                    verify_github_signature
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                  end
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56.

              1

                  # Verify the GitHub webhook signature
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def verify_github_signature
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            

            

                    # Get the raw payload
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            

            

                    payload_body = request.body.read
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            

            

                    request.body.rewind
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            

            

            
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            

            

                    # Get the signature header
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            

            

                    signature_header = request.headers["X-Hub-Signature-256"]
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            

            

                    unless signature_header.present?
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.warn("Missing X-Hub-Signature-256 header in GitHub webhook")
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            

            

                      render json: { error: "Missing signature header" }, status: :unauthorized
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            

            

                      return false
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            

            

                    end
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            

            

            
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            

            

                    # Calculate expected signature
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            

            

                    webhook_secret = Rails.application.credentials.dig(:github, :webhook_secret)
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            

            

                    unless webhook_secret.present?
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.error("GitHub webhook secret not configured")
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            

            

                      render json: { error: "Webhook secret not configured" }, status: :internal_server_error
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            

            

                      return false
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            

            

                    end
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            

            

            
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            

            

                    # Calculate the expected signature
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            

            

                    expected_signature = "sha256=#{OpenSSL::HMAC.hexdigest('SHA256', webhook_secret, payload_body)}"
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            

            

            
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            

            

                    # Use constant-time comparison to prevent timing attacks
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            

            

                    unless ActiveSupport::SecurityUtils.secure_compare(expected_signature, signature_header)
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            

            

                      Rails.logger.warn("Invalid GitHub webhook signature")
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            

            

                      render json: { error: "Invalid signature" }, status: :unauthorized
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            

            

                      return false
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            

            

                    end
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            

            

            
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            

            

                    true
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            

            

                  end
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            

            

            
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            

            

                  # Build a Domain Event from GitHub webhook data
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def build_domain_event(event_type, payload)
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            

            

                    # Build event data based on the event type
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            

            

                    case event_type
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            

            

                    when "push"
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            

            

                      build_push_event(payload)
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            

            

                    when "pull_request"
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            

            

                      build_pull_request_event(payload)
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            

            

                    when "pull_request_review"
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            

            

                      build_pull_request_review_event(payload)
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            

            

                    else
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            

            

                      # Generic handler for other event types
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            

            

                      build_generic_event(event_type, payload)
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            

            

                    end
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            

            

                  end
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            

            

            
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            

            

                  # Build a push event (commit)
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def build_push_event(payload)
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            

            

                    # Extract repository info
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            

            

                    repository = payload["repository"]["full_name"]
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            

            

                    ref = payload["ref"]
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            

            

                    branch = ref.gsub("refs/heads/", "")
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            

            

            
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            

            

                    # For push events, create an event for the push itself
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            

            

                    # Commits will be in the payload data
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            

            

                    receive_event(
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            

            

                      event_type: "push",
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            

            

                      data: {
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            

            

                        repository: repository,
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            

            

                        ref: ref,
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            

            

                        branch: branch,
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            

            

                        commits: payload["commits"],
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            

            

                        pusher: payload["pusher"],
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            

            

                        sender: payload["sender"]
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            

            

                      }
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            

            

                    )
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            

            

                  end
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            

            

            
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            

            

                  # Build a pull request event
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def build_pull_request_event(payload)
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            

            

                    # Extract PR info
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            

            

                    action = payload["action"]
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            

            

                    pr = payload["pull_request"]
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            

            

                    repository = payload["repository"]["full_name"]
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            

            

            
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            

            

                    receive_event(
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            

            

                      event_type: "pull_request",
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            

            

                      data: {
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            

            

                        repository: repository,
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            

            

                        action: action,
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            

            

                        number: pr["number"],
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            

            

                        title: pr["title"],
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            

            

                        user: pr["user"],
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            

            

                        base: {
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            

            

                          ref: pr["base"]["ref"],
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            

            

                          sha: pr["base"]["sha"]
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            

            

                        },
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            

            

                        head: {
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            

            

                          ref: pr["head"]["ref"],
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            

            

                          sha: pr["head"]["sha"]
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            

            

                        },
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            

            

                        created_at: pr["created_at"],
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157.

      158.

    159.

      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            

            

                        sender: payload["sender"]
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161.

      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            

            

                    )

      164.

                  # Build a pull request review event

                  def build_pull_request_review_event(payload)

      180.

      182.

    183.

      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            

            

                      }
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            

            

                    )
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            

            

                  end
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187.

                  def build_generic_event(event_type, payload)

                    receive_event(

    191. 
            

            

                      event_type: event_type,
          
      192.

                    )
          
      194.

                  end

                class MetricsController < ApplicationController

                  def index

                  def show

                  def analyze
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            

            

                    use_case = UseCaseFactory.create_detect_anomalies

                  private

                  def filter_params
          
      49.

                  end
          
      51.

                  def supports_action?(action)

                  # Validates that required parameters are present
          
      37.

                  # @param params [Hash] The parameters to validate
          
      38.

                  # @param required [Array<Symbol>] List of required parameter keys
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            

            

                  # @raise [ArgumentError] If any required parameters are missing
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
              1
            

            

                  def validate_required_params(params, required)
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            

            

                    missing = required.select { |param| params[param].nil? }
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            

            

                    return if missing.empty?
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            

            

            
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Missing required parameters: #{missing.join(', ')}"
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            

            

                  end
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46.

                  def valid?

    40.

                  def validate!
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Name cannot be empty" if name.nil? || name.empty?
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Severity must be one of: #{SEVERITIES.join(', ')}" unless SEVERITIES.include?(severity)
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Metric cannot be nil" if metric.nil?
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Metric must be a Core::Domain::Metric" unless metric.is_a?(Core::Domain::Metric)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Threshold cannot be nil" if threshold.nil?
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Timestamp must be a Time object" unless timestamp.is_a?(Time)
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            

            

                    raise ArgumentError, "Status must be one of: #{STATUSES.join(', ')}" unless STATUSES.include?(status)

    56. 
            

            

                  end

    150. 
            

            

                  end
          
      151.

                  def with_id(new_id)

    153. 
            

            

                    self.class.new(

                # Represents an automation rule in the system
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            

            

                # An automation rule consists of a set of conditions and actions
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            

            

                # When all conditions are met, the actions are executed
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            

            

                class AutomationRule
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            

            

                  attr_reader :id, :name, :description, :conditions, :actions, :enabled, :created_at, :updated_at

    8. 
            

            

            
          
      9.

                  # Initialize a new automation rule
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            

            

                  # @param id [String] Unique identifier for the rule
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            

            

                  # @param name [String] Human-readable name for the rule
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            

            

                  # @param description [String] Detailed description of what the rule does
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            

            

                  # @param conditions [Array<Hash>] Conditions that must be met for the rule to trigger
          
      14.

                  # @param actions [Array<Hash>] Actions to execute when conditions are met
          
      15.

                  # @param enabled [Boolean] Whether the rule is currently active
          
      16.

                  def initialize(id:, name:, conditions:, actions:, description: nil, enabled: true, created_at: Time.now, updated_at: Time.now)

    19. 
            

            

                    @id = id
